"A great sect arose which, taking for its motto the good and the happiness of man, worked in the darkness of the conspiracy to make the happiness of humanity a prey for itself. This sect is known to everyone: its brothers are known no less than its name. It is who have undermined the foundations of the Order to the point of complete overthrow; it is by them that all humanity has been poisoned and led astray for several generations, The ferment that reigns amongst the peoples is their work. Their founders arranged to introduce this pride into the heads of the peoples. They began by casting odium on religion.

They invented the rights of man which it is impossible to discover even in the book of Nature, and they urged the people to wrest from their princes the recognition of these supposed rights. The plan they had formed for breaking all social ties and of destroying all order was revealed in all their speeches and acts. They deluged the world with a multitude of publications; they recruited apprentices of every rank and in every position; they deluded the most perspicacious men by falsely alleging, different intentions. 

They sowed in the hearts of youth the seed of covetousness, and they excited it with the bait of the most insatiable passions. Indomitable pride, thirst of power, such were the only motives if the sect; their masters had nothing less in view than the thrones of the earth, and the government of nations was to be directed by their nocturnal clubs.

This is what has been done and is still being done. But we notice that princes and people are unaware how and by what means this is being accomplished. That is why we say to them in all frankness; The misuse of our Order, the misunderstanding of our secret, has produced all the political and moral troubles with which the world is filled to-day."

text:
I'm with him on 99% of this. I just hate that he, like almost everyone else that is for clean energy but generally ignorant about the actual workings of nuclear energy, lumps nuclear and coal/oil together, like nuclear is this horrible dirty energy of the past.

People need to realize that nuclear energy produces the smallest amount of waste per unit of energy produced of almost any source, and that's considering that we're still using technology, methods and the same radioactive source material from decades ago; if we could get our shit together and switch to Thorium already we'd make even more energy with even less waste at even lower risk factors. Sure solar and wind produce almost none, but they also produce much less overall energy, not enough to be the solution on their own for awhile.

TL;DR people need to stop treating nuclear energy as if it's part of the dirty energy problem and start realizing that it's part of the clean energy solution for the foreseeable future.

text:
why does everybody jump to fossil fuel emissions when talking about climate change?

Carbon Dioxide emissions aren't even the biggest threat to our atmosphere and climate conditions. Methane holds 23 TIMES the amount of global warming potential than CO2. even more than that, Nitrous Oxide holds nearly 300 TIMES the global warming potential of CO2.¬†

65% of Nitrous Oxide is produced by livestock.
30-40% of methane emissions are produced from the same source.

If people chose to stop supporting the meat, dairy, and egg industries, we could eliminate the #1 threat to our climate that stands today. It's a simple solution, but not many people are willing to change themselves, really.

author: Shinzu

text:
¬†@Soup Ntog¬†¬†I have gastroparesis. I can't eat seeds, lentils, spinach, anything vegetable unless in baby-food form, popcorn, corn, granola, nuts, potato skins, certain apples, the outer part of a strawberry...¬†Meat is the most efficient way to obtain iron, according to my dietician. Any other dietary source doesn't get absorbed efficiently enough given the amount of time it takes to digest. For context, three handfuls of popcorn sat in my stomach for 20 hours before it emptied and I could eat again. You have no idea what it's like to be starving to death and full at the same time. Going vegan would kill me. So maybe fuck off? Other than the controlled diet I'm on, my only other option is tube feeding, which I'd rather avoid.

Also, I grew up in farm country. While factory farms are awful environments for the animals, I've been to enough family farms to know that it's way better than most industries. If you want to avoid destructive immoral industries, throw out your phone and most of your clothes.¬†

I'm very glad the vegans and vegetarians I know in real life respect my medical situation and my personal choice, and don't act like self-righteous ableist douchecanoes.
author: Azura Rose

text:
¬†@Aduro Tri¬†¬†if you switched one meal a week from beef or a hamburger to vegetarian, you will decrease your carbon footprint more than if you reduced your food miles to zero (carbon footprint left by the food being shipped/drove/flown). That's just one meal a week. Your carbon footprint is lifted significantly if you cut out meat entirely, not even dairy/eggs.

The meat industry is also responsible for such a massive impact on those other issues you mentioned:
-half of all water used in U.S is given to raise animals for food (2,400 gallons for a single pound of beef).
-animal agriculture is #1 cause of water pollution (more than all over industrial sources combined, actually).
-55 square feet of rainforest are required for every single meal of meat
-14,400 acres are torn down every day to produce meat
-2.9 million acres torn down from amazon to grow crops to feed to animals.

So, you want to stop cutting down forest and destroying nature? veganism is a simple, and insanely powerful solution.

here's more statistics:
http://puu.sh/iOR2k/54492fa6eb.png
author: Youtube Soup

text: ¬†@Azura Rose¬†¬†ahh, see i've heard many people use "I need it for health reasons" and then go on a rant about protein with no actual diagnosis of any kind. author: Youtube Soup

text: ¬†@Azura Rose¬†¬†yeah my girlfriend has gastroparesis as well, she's a strict vegan. Her gastroenterologist was shitty so she had to figure out diets and stuff on her own, but it is very much possible.¬†
author: Youtube Soup

text:
¬†@Soup Ntog¬†¬†It depends on how the gastroparesis is, as it varies person to person. Some are tube fed and can't eat any food at all. With the level I'm at, it wouldn't be possible. My sister or mother could, though I'd definitely not recommend it. I don't care what your gf does, she can decide being vegan is not too difficult for her particular version of gastroparesis, or is important enough to be worth the health risks, but I suggest you not make that sort of decision for anyone else.¬†

In other news, I tried baby food for the first time today to try to add veggies back into my diet. Tasted disgusting, will stick to apple sauce, bananas, grapes, and blended yogurts. Started eating more meat and already feel less fatigued. Do I think normal people should eat meat daily like they do? No. Meat should be once a week with a normal diet, dairy daily. Both preferably from local butchers or farms. Again, I grew up around farms, I'd much rather support local businesses and cut down on shipping emission. I used to eat meat once or twice a month before, and now it's maybe once or twice a week. I need to be efficient with my intake, but nobody needs meat every day. You'll get way better traction suggesting a scale down and switching to local rather than cutting it out completely. I do agree with you that most people without specific dietary restrictions could substitute meat for other protein and iron sources easily enough, though they would have to eat more of it. Dairy is my life though. Milkshakes and smoothies are my go-to meals, especially to keep my weight up.

text:
¬†@*****¬† These are just the sort of hyperbolic claims I was referring to. What are your sources for any of these claims?

‚Äúthere will be no turning back the clock.‚Äù There have been warmer periods in the historic past. Greenland was farmed and vineyards grew in northern England during the Medieval. The disaster was when cold returned.

‚ÄúThere is no magic cold machine that will bring back or even sustain our Arctic regions.‚Äù Ever heard of the Little Ice Age? It brought famine and advancing glaciers - since then glaciers have been retreating. The next ice age is inevitable. Then we will see real catastrophic climate change.

‚ÄúIf you read any of the myriad of data available, All of it suggests that the amount of co2 accumulation is beyond repair.‚Äù All? None of it does. Read the IPCC‚Äôs AR5. Even it doesn‚Äôt make such wild claims, and that‚Äôs its job.

‚Äúco2 levels have steadily risen since around the industrial age.‚Äù We have little information about CO2 levels prior to the last half of the 20th century. CO2 emissions were insignificant prior to the 1940s, so if CO2 was indeed rising before then it could not have been caused by man-made CO2.

‚Äúsafe to say our actions have caused this steady increase.‚Äù Our CO2 emissions have not been steady but have increased exponentially. This has had little or no effect on the rate of atmospheric CO2 rise, which has been steady for 60 years, so there is no evidence of cause and effect.

‚Äúsea level rise would clearly be caused by the melting of cold solids which in turn is caused by co2 build up‚Äù Sea level rise has not accelerated as predicted. The rate of sea level rise today is the same as it was more than a century ago - long before CO2 could have been a factor. NEW YORK (THE BATTERY): http://www.psmsl.org/data/obtaining/rlr.monthly.plots/12_high.png


It is you who ‚Äúpick apart facts and use only the pieces" you deem palatable. But in your case ‚Äúpalatable‚Äù means apocalyptic. And your ‚Äúfacts‚Äù are fatuous claims made by alarmists in the media and by special interest groups, not by scientists.

Why is it that alarmists are angry instead of relieved when they see data that contradicts the predictions of doom? Do they really want doom? Or is ‚Äúclimate change‚Äù just a blunt weapons to ram through a political agenda?

You're right, I am much older than these kids. I have seen predictions of doom come and go. I was born into a world doomed to nuclear destruction. Then I was doomed by the population bomb whereby hundreds of millions would soon die form starvation or in food wars. Then pollution was killing off all life on earth. Then global cooling. Then the oil was running out. Then global warming. Then climate change.

I've slowly learned to look at the data behind the wild claims before I believe them.
